Job Title: Sr PM - Tech, F2 & XCat Tech, Lifestyle Based Shopping

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Product Management, Project Management

Description:
Description

Lifestyle Based Shopping team strives to deeply understand customer preferences, attributes, interests, style, and shopping choices to help them purchase products that fit their lifestyle and shopping mission. Our goal is to improve Amazon's credibility in niche categories like Fitness, team sports, outdoor activities, sports fan merchandise, as well as Luxury and Premium fashion. We achieve this by building features through the customer's journey enabling improved discovery, better product presentation and evaluation, building selection authenticity, and driving re-engagement and repeat visits for these stores.

As a Senior PMT, you will lead product strategy, turning customer insights and feedback into plans that accelerate delivery of the right product for our customers. You will work directly with dedicated engineering teams and senior leadership to drive product development, influencing fundamental technical design decisions, product roadmap, and long-term strategy. Our ideal teammate will possess a strong product management background and have experience leading high customer impact products. You are naturally curious, data-driven and entrepreneurial as you take end-to-end ownership for your product. You are the kind of leader who anticipates bottlenecks, deftly navigates ambiguity, makes informed trade-off decisions and skillfully balances the needs of the business versus technical constraints. You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills that help you build strong partnerships with colleagues and influence senior leaders.

This role is inherently cross-functional -- you will work closely with UX, software engineering, central teams, business teams, and executive stakeholders. You will also influence partner teams like Percolate, P13N, BuyX, Community Feedback, and SL Search to improve the holistic CX for lifestyle businesses. If you enjoy cutting through ambiguity, eliminating complexity and innovating on behalf of customers, come join us!

Key job responsibilities

 Develop and communicate a compelling product vision, strategy and solutions in partnership with UX, business, engineering, and partner teams. Deeply understand the systems we work with to support the long term technology strategy. Inspire brands and customers by consistently raising the bar on what it means to have the best digital fashion shopping experience in the world. Define the feature sets, business requirements, measures of success, and roadmap for your experiences.

Manage prioritization and trade-offs among customer experience, developers, schedule, performance and cost.

 Leverage data and define the success metrics for features or services to track performance, deep-dive on issues and uncover trends and patterns. Provide mentorship and best practices to the broader Product Management organization.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Seattle, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree 5+ years of technical product or program management experience Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product Experience managing technical products or online services Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive-level prioritization and planning

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience in using analytical tools, such as Tableau, Qlikview, QuickSight Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools
